oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Aerial photograph of North Nashville in vicinity of St. Cecilia Motherhouse, circa 1968
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Aerial photograph of a portion of North Nashville, in the Buena Vista neighborhood, looking to the northwest, circa 1968, taken by Metro Photographer, William M. King. Shows open fields (one with a pathway) and wooded residential area. Streets identified on the photograph include: 8th Avenue North and Clay Street. The large structures at right at the intersection of Clay and 8th Ave. are parts of St. Cecilia Motherhouse. The open fields behind the buildings are Buena Vista Park. A smokestack in the middle left distance is probably on the campus of North High School.
Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
Interstate 265 would pass near this location when it was built between 1968 and 1971. In 2000, Interstate 265 ceased to exist, and was redesignated as part of Interstate 65.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dominican Sisters of the Congregation of Saint Cecilia; North High School (Nashville, Tenn.);
